Biography

Colin Greenwood was born in Oxford, England on June 26, 1969. English bassist of the alternative rock group, Radiohead. They are best known for their debut single âCreep,â which became a worldwide hit off their debut album, Pablo Honey. He and Phil Selway are both members of Radiohead. He met his bandmates during a school production when he was 12 and they officially formed as a group in 1985.

On Popular Bio, He is one of the successful Bassist. He has ranked on the list of those famous people who were born on June 26, 1969. He is one of the Richest Bassist who was born in England. He also has a position among the list of Most popular Bassist. Colin Greenwood is 1 of the famous people in our database with the age of 50 years old.

Career

At the end of 1991, after a chance meeting between Colin Greenwood and A&R representative Keith Wozencroft at Our Price, the record shop where Greenwood worked, a six-album recording contract with EMI was signed on Friday and their name changed to Radiohead. By 2011, Radiohead sold more than 30 million albums worldwide. In March 2019, they were introduced to the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame.

Greenwood contributed bass to Jonny Greenwoodâs debut solo work Bodysong (2003), the music for the 2008 film Woodpecker, the 2018 album Amir by the Belgian-Egyptian singer Tamino. He played bass guitar on the track âOxygen Maskâ on Worldâs Strongest Man (2018) by Gaz Coombes and lead single âBrasilâ from Earth (2020), his Radiohead bandmate Ed OâBrienâs debut solo album.

In 2004, Greenwood participated in the Annual Sixth Form Conference held by Radley College, in collaboration with the School of St Helen and St Katharine, on Digital Rights Management (DRM). In 2013, Greenwood recorded a Dries van Noten runway show, performing a solo bass guitar. In 2018, Michael Palinâs book Erebus: The Story of a Ship for the Spectator was reviewed.
